A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I'm still up in the air about this one. I'd consider myself a big fan of the franchise\, as I was 5 when the original\, \"A New Hope\" was released in 1977. That was an age that made Space Smuggler\, Jedi Knight\, Stormtrooper\, and X-Wing Pilot\, a possible career path...haha. My oldest son was 5 when The Phantom Menace was released\, and as I saw history repeating itself\, I even gave the prequels some positive praise. The Force Awakens was a great addition in my opinion\, even though the story was pretty much in line with A New Hope. I didn't see the comparison to The Last Jedi and Empire Strikes Back\, as some are suggesting. What really threw me about this movie was the excess use of comedy. I felt like it was trying to compete with a Marvel movie\, when it should be completely the opposite. I mean of course there was drama\, but the impact of losing a character that was just introduced doesn't amount to much. Also\, some of the Jedi \"powers\" that are all of a sudden possible (like being able to survive the vacuum of space) where they were never seen in any previous movie\, kind of made it seem like they were a little too immortal\, and kind of broke the integrity of the movies before it. However\, without a doubt\, it was entertaining\, and worth seeing. Hopefully you'll be able to look past my opinionated faults and still be able to enjoy it.
